Element.Name: Customization identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.

Element.Name: Profile identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.

Element.Name: Catalogue identifier
Element.Description: An catalogue instance must contain an identifier. The identifier enables positive referencing the document instance for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Catalogue action code
Element.Description: Identifies how a received catalogue should be used against existing catalogue lines sent in previous catalogues

Element.Name: Catalogue name
Element.Description: A name of the catalogue for general reference. E.g. Christmas catalogue

Element.Name: Catalogue issue date
Element.Description: The date on which the catalogue instance was issued.

Element.Name: Catalogue version
Element.Description: The version of the catalogue revision. The version ID is used to controll how a Catalogue transaction acts on existing lines that are not stated in the transactions. Should they be left alone or deleted. If Catalogue transaction is ï¿½Replaceï¿½ then acti

Element.Name: Catalogue validity period
Element.Description: The period during which the content of the catalogue is valid and can be used for trade.

Element.Term: start date if both validity period end date and validity period start date are present.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Reference identifier
Element.Description: Positive identification of the reference such as a unique identifier.

Element.Name: Contract Issue date
Element.Description: Issue date for referenced contract

Element.Name: Reference type
Element.Description: The short description of what is reference such as contract type

Element.Name: Source catalogue identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the existing

Element.Name: Catalogue provider
Element.Description: The party that sends the catalogue.. The seller or a catalogue repository.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the providing party electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message.

Element.Name: Party identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Element.Term: EUGEN-T19-R044 ï¿½ A party identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute
Element.Name: R
Party name
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Identifier.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service

Element.Name: Country Subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2

Element.Name: Provider legal registration name
Element.Description: The name under which the provider is legally registered.

Element.Name: Provider legal registration identifier
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the identifier assigned to the party by the national company registrar.

Element.Name: Provider legal registration city
Element.Description: The name of the city where the provider is legally registered.

Element.Name: Provider legal registration country
Element.Description: The country in which the provider is legally registered.

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver
Element.Description: The party to which the catalogue is sent. Buyer or a catalogue repository on his behalf.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the receiving party electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message.

Element.Name: Party identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Element.Term: EUGEN-T19-R044 ï¿½ A party identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute
Element.Name: R
Party name
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Identifier.

Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service

Element.Name: Country Subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2

Element.Name: Receiver legal registration name
Element.Description: The name under which the receiver is legally registered.

Element.Name: Receiver legal registration identifier
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the identifier assigned to the party by the national company registrar.

Element.Name: Receiver legal registration city
Element.Description: The name of the city where the receiver is legally registered.

Element.Name: Receiver legal registration country
Element.Description: The country in which the receiver is legally registered.

Element.Name: Catalogue supplier
Element.Description: The party that provides the items specified in the catalogue.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the receiving party electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message.

Element.Name: Party identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Element.Term: EUGEN-T19-R044 ï¿½ A party identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute
Element.Name: R
Party name
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Identifier.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2

Element.Name: Contact person name
Element.Description: The name of the contact person.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number

Element.Name: Contact fax number
Element.Description: A fax number for the contact persons.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

Element.Name: Catalogue customer
Element.Description: The party who may order from the catalogue.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the receiving party electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message.

Element.Name: Party identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Element.Term: EUGEN-T19-R044 ï¿½ A party identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute
Element.Name: O
Party name
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Identifier.

Element.Name: Contact person name
Element.Description: The name of the contact person.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number

Element.Name: Contact fax number
Element.Description: A fax number for the contact persons.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

Element.Name: Catalogue line
Element.Description: Catalogue line content

Element.Name: Line identifier
Element.Description: Each line must have an identifier that is unique within the document to make it possible to positively reference the line. For example
Element.Value: BII2-T19-R024 - A catalogue line MUST contain a unique line identifier

Element.Name: Line action code
Element.Description: Used to instruct the catalogue receier on what action should be taken on the identified line when revising a catalogue. See rule on catalogue version ID. When using Update or Delete codes
Element.Value: CL-T19-001 - The action code for a catalogue line MUST be Add

Element.Name: Contract Subdivision
Element.Description: Used to reference a subsection of the contract referenced on header level but not recognized as a BII requirement. Removed.

Element.Name: Orderable indicator
Element.Description: Default value is True i.e. Item on the Catalogue Line can be ordered. Can be used to indicate if an Item is temporarily out of stock (via a Catalogue Update).

Element.Name: Orderable unit
Element.Description: The unit in which the item described in this catalogue line can be ordered. The same item can be described in more than one catalogue line with different orderble units. E.g. catalogue line 1 describes item X that can be ordered in boxes at a given price.

Element.Name: Item net quantity
Element.Description: The net quantity of the item that is contained in each consumable unit

Element.Name: Order quantity increment
Element.Description: The increment of Orderable units that can be ordered.

Element.Name: Minimum order quantity
Element.Description: The minimum number of orderable units that can be ordered according to details provided in the catalogue line
Element.Value: BII2-T19-R030 - Minimum quantity MUST be greater than zero

Element.Name: Maximum order quantity
Element.Description: The maximum number of orderable units that can be ordered according to details provided in the catalogue line
Element.Value: BII2-T19-R029 - Maximum quantity MUST be greater than zero

Element.Term: BII2-T19-R031 - Maximum quantity MUST be greater or equal to the Minimum quantity
Element.Name: O
Line warranty information
Element.Description: Warranty information that applies to the catalogue line item.

Element.Name: Packaging level
Element.Description: The packing level of the catalogue line.

Element.Name: Catalogue line validity period
Element.Description: The period during which the information in the catalogue line is valid. An orderable catalogue item is no longer orderable after the validity period expires. Used for example for promotional items or prices.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Standardized unit price
Element.Description: The item price based on a standarized unit. E.g. Price of each liter.

Element.Term: See guideline on Items and packing units in a catalogue.

Element.Name: Standard unit quantity
Element.Description: The quantity of standard units that are in each consumable unit. E.g. if consumable units are bottles and each bottle contains 0

Element.Term: See guideline on Items and packing units in a catalogue.

Element.Name: Standard unit of measure
Element.Description: The standar unit of measure used to enable comparison of item price to other items.

Element.Term: See guideline on Items and packing units in a catalogue.
Element.Description: OP-T19-002 - Unit code MUST be coded according to the UN/ECE Recommendation 20

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Element.Name: Packed units
Element.Description: The prepacking the article is available in inside the orderable unit (next lower level packing)

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Element.Name: Price lead time
Element.Description: The order lead time for the particular location.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Term: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region

Element.Name: state
Element.Description: province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2

Element.Term: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2

Element.Name: Item price
Element.Description: The price for the item at the specified locations.

Element.Term: The price is given for each orderable unit.

Element.Name: Price type
Element.Description: The type of the price so that the receiver knows if the price may be changed

Element.Name: OrderableUnit FactorRate
Element.Description: The factor used to convert the Base Quantity to an Orderable Unit. Must be specified if the Orderable Unit differs from the Base Quantity. If not present

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Item description
Element.Description: A detailed description of the item. Use one description pr. language

Element.Name: Packed quantity
Element.Description: The number of packed units that are in the orderable unit. E.g. if the orderable unit is a pallet that contains 30 boxes then the packed units are BOX and the packed quantity is 30.

Element.Name: Consumable unit quantity
Element.Description: Specifies the number of consumable units that are in each orderable unit.

Element.Term: See guideline on Items and packing units in a catalogue.

Element.Name: Item name
Element.Description: A short name for an item.

Element.Name: Item key words
Element.Description: Used to specify searchable keywords and/or synonyms for the Item. E.g. Item Name = Colgate or Total / Keyword =Toothpaste

Element.Name: Sellers item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the item.

Element.Name: Manufacturers item identifer
Element.Description: The manufacturers identifier for the item.

Element.Name: Items standard identifier
Element.Description: A item identifier based on a registered schema.

Element.Term: A positive identification of the relevant document
A short description of the document type.
Element.Name: unbounded

Element.Term: The attached document embedded as binary object.

Element.Name: External item specifications
Element.Description: URI reference to external item information or specifications. E.g. web address

Element.Name: Item origin country
Element.Description: Used to provide the country from which the item has it's origin. Commonly used in cross border trade for statistical and customs purposes.

Element.Name: Commodity classification
Element.Description: A classification code used to classify the type or nature of the Item. More than one classifications can be used including UNSPSC code and CPV code.

Element.Name: Hazardous UNDG code
Element.Description: Provides detail of the classification and nature of a hazardous item.

Element.Name: Hazard class identifier
Element.Description: Provides detail of the classification and nature of a hazardous item.

Element.Name: Item VAT category code
Element.Description: The VAT code that indicates what VAT details apply to the item.

Element.Name: Item VAT precentage
Element.Description: The VAT percentage rate that applies to the item unless specific trade reasons apply such as exemptions.

Element.Term: The name of the property. The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant.

Element.Name: Property value
Element.Description: The value of the item property.

Element.Name: if relevant. May not be relevant when properties are descriptive.
Property classification
Element.Description: Standardized and predefined classification of items properties.

Element.Name: Manufacturer party name
Element.Description: The name of the manufacturer of the item

Element.Name: Item best before date
Element.Description: Used to express the best before date of the item or items in the line instance.

Element.Name: Item batch identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the production batch that the item(s) listed in the catalogue line were part of.

Element.Name: Label name
Element.Description: The name of the product label.

Element.Name: Label type
Element.Description: The label type such environmental

Element.Name: Label value
Element.Description: The lable value that applies to the item.

Element.Name: Label reference
Element.Description: A reference to where the label specification can be found
Description of requirments that relate to the transport of the item itself or the orderable unit in which it is contained.

Element.Term: The horizontal measure of the longer site of the orderable unit
The horizontal measure of the shorter side of the orderable unit.
The weight of the orderable unit incuding its packaging.

Element.Name: Dimension description
Element.Description: Used for differentiating between measures with same attributeID
